comment.author: 41901122@N00
comment._content:
Wonderful record from the archives...

seen in Australian Railway Stations

comment.author: 14867000@N00
comment._content: Wonderful! - it is/was such a pretty railway station.  In my Glenbrook days it used to win the "Best railway garden" awards regularly... from times when people cared about such things.  What's also interesting is that for a photo that is 110 years old, this view hasn't changed too much!

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/ozjulian] That is interesting to now about the "best railway garden awards". You might be interested in this 1959 photo - no wonder awards were won with this dedication! AB

comment.author: 14867000@N00
comment._content: Thanks for pointing out the gardening picture! As I said, these are different times, now the same station has barred windows and few gardens, a much more utilitarian place and much less pleasant. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Rlwy_stn_glenbrook.jpg By the way this station was built and in service in 1913 so the date in your description can't be correct. It is located on a completely new line that was opened in 1913, the old line and station were on the other side of the current shops, 1km or so away.

comment.author: 47321757@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/ozjulian] This photograph actually shows the earlier Glenbrook station that was built with duplication in 1902 and was deviated in 1913. The view is looking towards Sydney. Although the building looks similar, several differences distinguish it from the current station.

comment.author: 14867000@N00
comment._content: Ah that makes sense, thanks!  The buildings really are similar .. again it was in the days when time moved more slowly so if it worked today, it'd work in ten years' time.
